intro: Centaurea cataonica subsp. cataonica, commonly known as the Cyprus star-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cyprus. It is characterized by its spiny, upright growth habit and produces vibrant purple to red flowers in summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in open habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ornamental value. However, it can be invasive in some regions outside its native range.
